body_html: I'm working on a new truncated normal function with minval and maxval parameters, and batching. Some of the distributions you mentioned are already implemented in Python. We could add Gumbel and Poisson distributions there too. I'm not sure if we need beta or negative binomial distributions if they can be calculated easily from the other ones, but it wouldn't hurt to have a Python implementation of them too.
body_text: I'm working on a new truncated normal function with minval and maxval parameters, and batching. Some of the distributions you mentioned are already implemented in Python. We could add Gumbel and Poisson distributions there too. I'm not sure if we need beta or negative binomial distributions if they can be calculated easily from the other ones, but it wouldn't hurt to have a Python implementation of them too.
body: I'm working on a new truncated normal function with minval and maxval parameters, and batching. Some of the distributions you mentioned are already implemented [in Python](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/tree/master/tensorflow/contrib/distributions/python/ops). We could add Gumbel and Poisson distributions there too. I'm not sure if we need beta or negative binomial distributions if they can be calculated easily from the other ones, but it wouldn't hurt to have a Python implementation of them too.
